hints.content: For $\dfrac12$ and $\dfrac24$ to be equivalent, they must be fractions of  the same size whole.
Which image shows $\dfrac12$ and $\dfrac24$ represented on the same size whole?

options.alt: Two circles that are the same size. The circles are separated by an equal sign. The top circle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom circle is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded. !

Two circles that are the same size. The circles are separated by an equal sign. The top circle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom circle is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded. !

choices.content: ![A rectangle and a square separated by an equal sign. The rectangle is larger than the square. The rectangle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The square is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/82c784257775b231e140f221601d2ef8ff8be792)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0b4a2cf043b422176a30a27fd3cb320b1e9dcd46)

![Two circles that are the same size. The circles are separated by an equal sign. The top circle is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom circle is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/6a84fdae573769ded0e786b4d04e756d7399c0ad)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d1d7a070a34d8354f7e79a835291c07978a5c4d7)

![Two irregular six-sided polygons. The shape of both is identical, but the top polygon is smaller than the bottom polygon. An equal sign separates the shapes. The top polygon is divided into two equal parts. One part is shaded. The bottom polygon is divided into four equal parts. Two parts are shaded.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/407e0c0931c61c5700a3d3b6c31f4365d1bd360f)$=$![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1ede8b1d1648d56caad5e07037774308a3a44566)
